title: Shining a light on neuromorphic computing
summary: A review article titled "Integrated Optical Memristors" published in Nature Photonics discusses the potential of optical memristors in revolutionizing high-bandwidth neuromorphic computing, machine learning hardware, and artificial intelligence. Led by Nathan Youngblood, the article explores the current state-of-the-art and highlights the need for scalability in this emerging field. Optical memristors offer advantages such as high-speed data storage and retrieval, energy efficiency, and parallel processing. However, the challenge lies in finding a technology that is compact, efficient, fast, and capable of changing optical properties significantly.
